CatDescriptText: William Brozewicz, printer, Allison Park, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you believe that Patrice Lumumba, deposed Premier, was a good or evil influence on the Congo, in his quest for the natives to rule themselves? Do you believe his slaying was justified?"  Answer reads: "I think he was an evil influence...Anything that Russia backs can't be much good to any people...As to whether or not the slaying was justified.  I might say that I think about the locality, and also the fact that it wasn't too many years ago that similar methods were resorted to here...It hasn't been too long ago since we indulged in such things ourselves."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Brozewicz wearing fedora, plaid shirt, and two toned zippered jacket with ribbed collar, standing on sidewalk in front of ribbed metal wall, Smithfield Street, Downtown
